msgSnippet: Like many of the tools discussed, SilverMark s Test Mentor (www.javatesting.com) generates test stubs. The latest release generates JUnit-style tests, as well

Like many of the tools discussed, SilverMark's Test Mentor
(www.javatesting.com) generates test stubs.
The latest release generates JUnit-style tests, as well as reusable,
supporting test assets for state extraction, validation, gold-standard
reference values and object instantiation.

Another interesting thing it provides is the ability to run your application
and monitor interactions with a particular object. It will then generate a
test that mimics the interactions with that object. So for example, you've
inherited a pile of code in some legacy application and would like to
refactor part of it but don't have any test cases. Test Mentor will enable
you to use the application and by doing so, generate tests for it.

Here's some links:
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Screen captures and overview
http://www.silvermark.com/evaluators/5.4releasediagram.html

"Test Mentor - Java Edition product brief"
Two page product summary that gives the bare essentials to SilverMark's
approach to Java component testing
http://www.silvermark.com/documentation/productBrief.pdf

"The fifteen-minute overview to SilverMark's Test Mentor - Java Edition"
An informal equivalent of a white paper that should take about fifteen
minutes to read
http://www.javatesting.com/documentation/fifteenminuteguide.pdf

"A Hands-on Introduction to Visual Test Composition with SilverMark's Test
MentorT - Java Edition" Tutorial-style introduction to some of Test Mentor's
visual test composition facilities.
http://www.silvermark.com/documentation/visualcomposition.pdf

"A roadmap to full-cycle developer and QA testing"
Slides presented at STAR-EAST 2000
http://www.silvermark.com/News/presentations/QADeveloperRoadmap.ppt

"Collaborative Model for Developers and Testers using XP"
Paper presented at XP Universe 2001 that talks about some of the ways that
Test Mentor pulls QA teams into the component testing process from the
perspective of Extreme Programming
http://www.javatesting.com/documentation/developerQACollaboration.pdf

JUnit Feature Guide
This describes one of the latest features, our transparent integration with
JUnit assets:
http://www.javatesting.com/documentation/stmjunit.pdf

^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
Mike Silverstein
SilverMark, Inc.
The object testing company
http://www.silvermark.com

> -----Original Message-----
> From: markus baumgartner [mailto:mbg@...]
> Sent: Friday, March 15, 2002 11:14 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Is there a tool which generates JUnit-test stubs?
>
>
>
> I'm spending a lot of time passing new method into the testclass
> and write a
> "test_" in front of it (and oftenly forget to do it, too).
> I made a try to automate the creation of stubs for all existing
> methods of a
> class using the Reflection API (e.g. from myProcedure(int A, String B) to
> test_myProcedure_int_A_String_B. The final goal would be to have the tool
> comparing the class to the test_class and create stubs for new methods
> while leaving the existing ones untouched.
>
> Before I'm going to create it on my own, I wanted to know, if
> anybody knows
> about an existing tool, that does the job?
>
> If it does not exist, is there a good reason, why this automation wouldn't
> make sense? Sometimes for complex function you may need several testcases,
> but they can be easely created by taking the first stub and append a
> number...
>
>
>
>

subject: RE: [junit] Is there a tool which generates JUnit-test stubs?
